title: Free Cell Phones and Wireless Plans: Do You Qualify for Safelink or ACP
seoTitle: Free Phones & Plans: Safelink and ACP Explained
summary: Learn about the SafeLink program and the Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) to check if you qualify for free cell phones and wireless plans. Find out how these programs can help low-income individuals access essential communication services at an affordable cost.

body.raw:
## Free phone service might still be on the table‚Äîeven after ACP‚Äôs wind-down. You‚Äôve probably heard the Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) ran out of funding, but the Lifeline program still exists‚Äîand many carriers (like SafeLink) continue to offer free plans if you qualify. Here‚Äôs how to act fast and avoid common snags. If you‚Äôre in , , coverage maps, SIM delivery, and renewal rules aren‚Äôt identical‚Äîlook for callouts to sidestep delays.

Quick links for , :

  • Apply for free phone service (SafeLink)
  • Apply for SNAP (food assistance)
 ## Quick wins you can try today - **Check your lane:** ACP has ended for now, but **Lifeline** is active nationwide and on Tribal lands; many households still qualify via income or participation in programs like SNAP/Medicaid. - **Make a docs bundle:** photo ID, address, proof of eligibility (benefit letter or income), and last four digits of SSN or alternative ID‚Äîsaved as clear PDFs/photos. - **Pick a participating carrier (e.g., SafeLink) and start the application.** If a document is missing, submit what you have and upload the rest promptly. - **One-per-household rule:** confirm no one at your address is already using the same benefit; use the program‚Äôs household worksheet if asked. - **Keep a simple log:** dates, who you spoke with, confirmation numbers‚Äîhandy for follow-ups or recertification. - **If you had ACP before:** ask your carrier what your plan looks like **now** under Lifeline-only and whether you must opt in to keep service. ## ACP ended‚ÄîLifeline remains: what actually changed in 2024‚Äì2025 - **The big shift:** ACP‚Äôs monthly internet/phone discount wound down due to funding; providers adjusted plans. **Lifeline did not end** and continues as a separate benefit. - **What to expect now:** benefit amounts and included features differ from ACP; expect **leaner plans** unless your carrier offers an add-on or a separate low-cost plan. - **Who still qualifies:** Lifeline eligibility hinges on **income (typically ‚â§135% FPG)** or participation in qualifying programs; Tribal benefits may be higher. - **Timing matters:** if your ACP-linked plan changed, carriers may ask you to **affirm** continuing service or migrate to a Lifeline plan‚Äîmissed notices can interrupt service. - **Pro move:** call support and ask, ‚ÄúWhat exact plan do I have today without ACP, and what proofs do you still need from me?‚Äù How to Get Free or Discounted Internet Through Federal Programs ## Same address, different result: why state rules and carrier plans don‚Äôt match - **Different administrators, different details:** states can have unique processes layered on top of federal rules; carriers also tailor plans by coverage and costs. - **Verification quirks:** address formatting, apartment/suite numbers, or mismatched names can trigger flags; match your documents exactly. - **Device options vary:** some carriers supply SIM-only; others offer refurbished phones‚Äîask what‚Äôs included before you switch. - **Keep your number:** request number porting if you change carriers; gather your account number/PIN from the old provider first. - **Tribal lands & special cases:** enhanced Lifeline support or alternate proofs may apply; ask specifically about Tribal eligibility in your area.
üëâ Want a quick read on eligibility? Check benefits for .
 ---

FAQs for ,

## FAQs ### Is ACP really over? What does that mean for me? ACP ended for now due to lack of funding. Many households can still qualify for **Lifeline** phone or internet benefits through participating carriers like SafeLink. ### What proofs do I need for Lifeline? A photo ID, address, and either income proof or a qualifying-program letter (for each adult if required). Your carrier or the verifier may request additional details. ### Can I keep my number if I switch carriers? Usually yes‚Äîask for your current account number and transfer PIN first, then start service with the new provider and request port-in during activation. ### My application stalled‚Äîwhat should I check? Name/address formatting, document clarity, and whether another person at your address already uses the benefit. Re-upload clearer files and confirm your contact info. --- ###### References
FCC ‚Äî Affordable Connectivity Program (wind-down overview)
FCC ‚Äî ACP Has Ended: Consumer FAQ (June 2024)
FCC ‚Äî Lifeline Support for Affordable Communications
USAC ‚Äî Lifeline: Do I Qualify?
SafeLink ‚Äî ACP Updates and Next Steps
AP News ‚Äî After millions lose ACP subsidy, FCC explores stopgaps (2024)
